item.title: Coronavirus: Lockdown to ease further in England from Saturday
item.description: More beauty treatments, small wedding receptions and live indoor shows can resume this weekend.

item.title: France to be added to UK quarantine countries
item.description: People returning from the Netherlands and Malta from Saturday will also have to self-isolate.

item.title: A-levels: Anger over 'unfair' results this year
item.description: There are calls for a review and free appeals as concern grows over "volatility" in this year's results.

item.title: A-level results day: 'I haven't got into uni because of it'
item.description: Some students who haven't got the results they wanted are angry about how the situation has been dealt with.

item.title: Fortnite: Apple ban sparks court action from Epic Games
item.description: Epic Games says it is taking Apple to court over "monopolistic" policies after it banned Fortnite.

item.title: Trump blocks postal funds to prevent expanded mail-in voting
item.description: The Postal Service requires emergency funds to cope with the pandemic and the election, Democrats say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Greencore staff self-isolate after outbreak
item.description: Health officials are working with the sandwich makers in Northampton, where 299 tested positive.

item.title: Israel and UAE strike historic deal to normalise relations
item.description: Israel and the United Arab Emirates agree to normalise relations in the third Israel-Arab peace deal.

item.title: Stonehaven train derailment: Tributes paid to three victims
item.description: Brett McCullough, Donald Dinnie and Christopher Stuchbury died when the train left the track near Stonehaven.

item.title: Lindsay Birbeck murderer Rocky Marciano Price named
item.description: The 17-year-old boy who murdered Lindsay Birbeck is named as Rocky Marciano Price.

item.title: Two Penarth arrests after armed police called to reports of a shooting
item.description: Armed officers were sent to the scene, but police say there are no reports of serious injuries.

item.title: Three hurt in St Ives waterfront bar kitchen explosion
item.description: A witness reports hearing an explosion and one casualty is airlifted to hospital with serious burns.

item.title: Nick Cave compares cancel culture to 'bad religion'
item.description: The musician believes political correctness online is having an "asphyxiating effect" on society.

item.title: The Papers: Results "fiasco" and new UK quarantine for France
item.description: Many of Friday's papers lead on reaction to A-level results and calls for the system to be reviewed.

item.title: Coronavirus: Preparing for a post-lockdown musical
item.description: The cast and crew of Sleepless describe the preparations for their ''coronavirus-safe'' production.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Children dealing with the trauma of the explosion
item.description: Thousands of injured, displaced and traumatised children are dealing with the aftermath of the port explosion.

item.title: Lightning pictures: Spectacular storms light up England skies
item.description: Photos from across England show a remarkable lightning show on a stormy Wednesday night.

item.title: Golden eagles breeding success at Scottish Highlands estate
item.description: The raptors have bred on an estate in the Scottish Highlands for the first time in 40 years.

item.title: California officer saves man stuck on train tracks in wheelchair
item.description: Officer Erika Urrea took action when she saw a 66-year-old man in a wheelchair on the tracks as a train was approaching.

item.title: Pardner: The young people saving money the Jamaican way
item.description: With finances stretched by Covid-19 these young people are supporting each other to save money.

item.title: Dolphin stampede wows whale watchers
item.description: A safari group sailing near Dana Point in southern California came across a travelling pod of dolphins.

item.title: First-time buyers: Four ways the property market 'will be tougher'
item.description: UK house prices are predicted to fall but a report spells out why property may remain out of reach.

item.title: 'Why I stopped hiding my scars'
item.description: Jayne, Emily, Laura and Aimee talk about their scars, and how they came to accept them.

item.title: The millions being made from cardboard theft
item.description: With the global market for recycled cardboard worth billions of dollars, it is attracting criminals.

item.title: Belarus elections: Shocked by violence, people lose their fear
item.description: Defiance is spreading in the face of attacks by police on people in the streets and detainees.

item.title: What Europe's cities are doing to handle heatwaves
item.description: As London swelters, we look at how urban areas can adapt to deal with higher temperatures.

item.title: Why the Mauritius oil spill is so serious
item.description: The location of the Mauritian oil spill means the environmental consequences could be long-lasting.

item.title: Americans, go home: Tension at Canada-US border
item.description: Fears about spikes in US Covid-19 cases have led to some hostility between Canadians and Americans.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the world vaccinate seven billion?
item.description: Why fridges, vials and polling stations could be key in the distribution of a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I find a new job?
item.description: Jobseekers are having a tough time at the moment but some sectors are hiring and support is available.

item.title: Bowlers put England on top against Pakistan - report & highlights
item.description: England's bowlers grab the upper hand in the second Test against Pakistan on a weather-affected first day at the Ageas Bowl.

item.title: Leipzig shock Atletico to reach Champions League semi-final
item.description: RB Leipzig will play Paris St-Germain in the last four of the Champions League after Tyler Adams' late deflected winner knocks out Atletico Madrid.

item.title: Defending champion Andreescu pulls out of US Open
item.description: Defending champion Bianca Andreescu withdraws from this year's US Open because the coronavirus pandemic has hampered her return from injury.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan punches table at World Snooker Championship in match against Mark Selby
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan punches the table after missing a tough pink at the World Snooker Championship in his semi-final match against Mark Selby.

item.title: Fans to be allowed to attend Crucible final as government green lights pilot events
item.description: Fans to be allowed into the Crucible Theatre this weekend for the final of the World Snooker Championship, BBC Sport understands.

item.title: England v Pakistan highlights: James Anderson leads the way as England get their noses in front on a rain-affected day
item.description: James Anderson leads the way for England as the hosts take five wickets on a rain-affected day at Southampton to put themselves in a strong position in the second Test against Pakistan.

item.title: 'He's exhausted after that' - The one with Anthony McGill and the really long snooker cue
item.description: Anthony McGill uses all the extensions available to him to help with a difficult shot but then decides not to use it in a tense semi-final with Kyren Wilson.

item.title: A-level results: 'My future has been set back completely'
item.description: Students share their disappointment after their predicted exam results were downgraded.

item.title: A levels: Why did I not get the grades I expected?
item.description: Education editor Branwen Jeffreys explains how A-level grades were decided this year and what you can do if you didn't get what you expected.

item.title: Exam results: Do I have a right to know my child's results? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: How have my exam results been decided this year?
item.description: With exams in the UK cancelled this year, students' grades have been 'calculated' instead.

item.title: BTec Nationals: Who are the students who didn't just do A-levels?
item.description: All about the BTec National, one of the popular alternatives to A-levels.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I go to university this year?
item.description: Will students have online or face-to-face learning this autumn, and will they still have to pay full fees?

item.title: Exam results: 'Mocks aren't a fair way to decide grades'
item.description: A-level student Mia Cleal-Bramley explains why she doesn't want to rely on her mock exam results.
